explains: adj. 无与伦比的，无双的；前所未有的，从未经历过的，独特的

sentences.en: The book has enjoyed a success unparalleled in recent publishing history.
sentences.cn: 这本书在近期出版史上是空前的成功。

sentences.en: The Renaissance was an epoch of unparalleled cultural achievement.
sentences.cn: 文艺复兴是一个文化上取得空前成就的时代。

sentences.en: Could we render this inimitable picture properly, then would everybody exclaim, "Beautiful, unparalleled Italy!"
sentences.cn: 如果我们能把这幅独一无二的图画恰当地描绘出来，那么人人都会惊叹：“美丽无比的意大利！”
